name: CARE USA
mission:
CARE works around the globe to save lives and defeat poverty.
Your support helps CARE restore clean water, deliver medical supplies, keep girls in school, feed families through famine, and rebuild after disaster.
With 80 years of service, CARE has a history of building community trust. We listen to what people want and develop solutions they need. Every day, together with you, CARE saves lives and helps millions of people find the way to a better life worldwide.
programs: Service Systems Strengthening and Social Accountability (4SA)
theoryOfChange: CARE’s 4SA theory of change states that if CARE shares resources and skills; facilitates access to information, negotiation, and accountability spaces; builds institutional leadership, governance, and coordination; strengthens service delivery, infrastructure, and resources; facilitates equal planning and financing; and changes social norms within communities and societies, then this will build agency, relations, and structures, resulting in equal, high-quality, accountable services and support for marginalized and excluded women and girls in all their diversity.

all_citations.claim: CAREHQ reported total revenue of $909,098,267 and a program expense ratio of 91.1%.
The organization works with local partners and global institutions to reach people through education, health, and skills programs.
The charity offers various giving methods for donors to support its global mission.
CAREHQ holds a 96.25/100 score, with fundraising efficiency of $0.06 per $1 raised and 5.0 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: CAREHQ earns a high overall rating due to its massive operational scale, excellent Charity Navigator score of 96.25/100, and its efficient use of donor funds for humanitarian relief.
areas_for_improvement: Increasing direct cost-effectiveness per beneficiary to further maximize the impact of capacity-building initiatives

dimension_explanations.alignment: CAREHQ is highly aligned with donors seeking to address urgent humanitarian needs and systemic poverty [4]. As a Sadaqah-eligible organization, it provides a trusted pathway for general charitable giving toward global empowerment and crisis response [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high effectiveness by reaching millions through programs in education, health, and skills training [2]. With a program expense ratio of 91.1% and a Charity Navigator score of 96.25/100, CAREHQ maintains high standards of accountability while focusing on long-term capacity building [1][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: CAREHQ is a high-impact humanitarian organization dedicated to poverty alleviation through global partnerships and a focus on women and girls.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 91.1%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need
High fundraising efficiency with costs limited to $0.06 per $1 raised
Strong financial health with 5.0 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: CAREHQ operates by collaborating with local partners, governments, and private sectors to deliver large-scale humanitarian aid and development programs [2]. The organization reported a total revenue of $909,098,267, maintaining a strong commitment to financial efficiency and transparency [1][4].

case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="15">lack of long-term external impact evaluations</cite> despite high output numbers.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="1">81-year track record</cite>, <cite id="10">Platinum Candid status</cite>, and <cite id="12">96% independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: Credibility is already high; maintaining current <cite id="10">transparency standards</cite> is recommended.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="7">90.3% program ratio</cite> and a cost-per-beneficiary of <cite id="17">$14.30</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="15">tracking outcomes over at least 3 years</cite> to move beyond output metrics.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value institutional stability and want to support large-scale humanitarian relief with a focus on women's empowerment.
donor_motivations: Want to support one of the world's most established humanitarian brands
Value high financial efficiency in large-scale operations
Care about the intersection of poverty and gender equality
Prefer organizations with strong third-party accountability ratings
giving_considerations: Donations support a massive global infrastructure rather than a single local project
The organization focuses on capacity building and systems change
Financial reserves are healthy, indicating long-term sustainability

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: While CARE reports massive outputs, it currently lacks the multi-year external evaluations required for a higher grade.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CARE works through a 'poverty-plus' model, addressing the root causes of poverty by empowering women and strengthening local systems.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale distributions like flour and water translate into long-term poverty reduction.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a goal to reach 200 million people by 2030, the organization has significant capacity to absorb and deploy new capital.

peer_comparison.differentiator: CARE's <cite id="7">90.3% program ratio</cite> outperforms the <cite id="9">peer median of 87.6%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="7">90.3% of its total expenses to programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="9">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
CARE holds a <cite id="10">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="6">96.25/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>.
In the last year, the charity reached <cite id="4">21.9 million people</cite> and delivered <cite id="11">14.6 million liters of clean water</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: CARE's operational strength lies in its ability to maintain high efficiency despite its size. With <cite id="2">over $909 million in revenue</cite>, the organization manages to keep <cite id="8">fundraising costs at just $0.06 per dollar</cite>. Their governance is equally strong, featuring an <cite id="12">independent board of 26 members</cite> and a <cite id="13">perfect 100/100 score in Culture and Leadership</cite> from third-party evaluators. This institutional maturity allows them to manage <cite id="14">$202.5 million in foreign grants</cite> across hundreds of recipients globally, ensuring localized impact through a sophisticated grantmaking infrastructure.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1945</cite>, CARE is a global humanitarian leader focused on ending poverty through a specific lens of empowering women and girls. The organization operates at a massive scale, reporting <cite id="2">$909,098,267 in total revenue</cite> for the 2024 fiscal year. Their operational model emphasizes <cite id="3">collaborating with local partners and governments</cite> to deliver sustainable development and emergency relief. In 2024 alone, the organization reached <cite id="4">21.9 million people</cite> through its diverse programming, which includes <cite id="5">crisis response, food security, and health services</cite>. Financial stewardship remains a hallmark of the organization, as evidenced by its <cite id="6">96.25/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. By maintaining a <cite id="7">91.1% program expense ratio</cite>, the charity ensures that the vast majority of its nearly billion-dollar budget is directed toward direct service and capacity building rather than administrative overhead. This efficiency is further highlighted by a fundraising cost of only <cite id="8">$0.06 per $1 raised</cite>, placing it well above industry standards for large-scale non-profits.
